alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Orange; Osceola; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seminole, southeastern Orange, central Volusia and north central Osceola Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near DeLand Airport to near Sanford to Geneva to 7 miles east of Narcoossee. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... East Orlando, Sanford, Geneva, Oviedo, Deltona, Lake Helen, Osteen, Samsula and Spruce Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
